info.name: carving a sphere in a cube
info.description:
How to carve a sphere trapped into a cube ( in wood, soap of potatoe ) : first steps.
( I use a drill for extremities then a scroll saw to hollow the band in between ).
mouse controls camera

renderpass.code:
#define rot(a)  mat2(cos(a+vec4(0,11,33,0)))               // rotation 

#define H(a)        a.z < .7 ? abs(.7*(a.x+a.y)-1.1) - .1 : 9. 
/**  // with drill marks                  
#define H(a)        min( length(a.yz-.6) -.15 ,                       \
                    min( a.z<.7 ? abs(.7*(a.x+a.y)-1.)-.05 : 9.,      \
                         a.y<.7 ? abs(.7*(a.x+a.z)-1.)-.05 : 9.  ) )
/**/                    
/**  // with more drill marks                           
#define H(a)  min(  min( length(a.yz-.7) , min( a.z<.6 ? abs(.7*(a.x+a.y)-1.2)+.15 : 9.,      \
                                                a.y<.6 ? abs(.7*(a.x+a.z)-1.2)+.15 : 9.  ) ), \
                    min( length(vec2(a.y,.7*abs(a.x+a.z))-.7) ,                     \
                         length(vec2(.7*abs(a.x+a.y),a.z)-.7))   ) -.2
/**/                         
void mainImage(out vec4 O, vec2 U)
{
    float t=9.,m;
    vec3  R = iResolution,
          D = normalize(vec3(U+U, -12.*R.y) - R),          // ray direction
          p = vec3(0,0,20), q,a,                           // marching point along ray 
          M = iMouse.z > 0. ? 6.*iMouse.xyz/R -3.
              :  vec3( 1,.5,0) * cos(.3*iTime + vec3(0,11,0)); 
     
          
    for ( O=vec4(1); O.x > 0. && t > .01; O-=.01 )         // march scene
        q = p, 
        q.yz *= rot(-M.y),                                 // rotations
        q.xz *= rot(-M.x-1.57), 
        a = abs(q),
        t = max( max(a.x, max(a.y,a.z)) - 1.,              // cube
                -min( H(a), min(H(a.yzx),H(a.zxy) )) ),    // holes
        p += .5*t*D;                                       // step forward = dist to obj    
      

    O *= O*O*1.5;                                          // color scheme
}
